author: racher06
comment: Waste of money.   Does not give you any worthwhile information. Fee app is almost exactly the same.   Should be ashamed of themselves for even asking money for this.  Does not mention you need to purchase additional hardware to monitor own consumption.  Uninstalled after 4 hours and reverted to free app.

author: Mike Neeson
comment: I'm guessing the people who hate this app didn't pay their installer for the full monitoring service. This app is really good. Can monitor load, see monute by minute where the power is being used and where the excess is going. Helps my family tailor our usage to when we're generating peak power. Love it.

author: David Lim
comment: Extremely difficult to install and the manual didn't have accurate instructions either. But once it's up and running it provides basic information on your PVS. Fronius should invest some money and resources into developing a better app because this definitely isn't up to standard.

As it is, this app not beneficial. Map on app has us being in Australia which is correct. The day and time of day are not correct for us here. For example 5/7/17 has half of yesterday's production from 00:00 to 4.45am, zero production from 4.45am-7pm, then further production from 7pm-00:00am. Now we are in the southern hemisphere but I can guarantee our sun is NOT shining at night!   Please look into this and fix the issue then this app may be quite useful to us.

author: Ramona Griffin
comment: It took me 6hrs to set the app upp. I ended up doing it through the solar website then logging in on app and it worked. It gives you so much information and great to track everything. Its also setup for battery and consumption meter too. Love it.

The in depth graphs and information are nice and show another view of what your solar and house are doing (get the smart metering installed it's worth it).  The interface is clumbsy and there is little explanation about what it shows but once you figure it out its good.  The web page version is just as useful really and that is free! Don't waste your money like I did.

author: Ben Neill
comment: So this app, if you forked out for the extra monitoring, does what it says. It just does it so BADLY.  * Performs badly on my pixel.... Judders and freezes while scrolling. * When reopened, displays bad data while it refreshes. * Design is inconsistent at best. Ignores most Android recommendations and best practises * Icons don't make sense. No title or explanation when tapped on.  This is just what I have noticed after a day of use.  To ask $5 for this is pretty galling after forking out for the inverter AND the monitoring equipment, let alone when it is such an unprofessional app. If you have a fronius, you are probably stuck with this junk, if you haven't already, well, you know what you're in for.

author: Paul C
comment: Very poor app, no better than the free version as the extra consumption monitor doesn't work. Save you money and time, don't buy this!

author: John Hoffman
comment: Widget never works unless you open the app, then it connects to get data. For a paid app this is rip off. Been like this for ages with no fix. Get your act together please

author: Darryl Pitcher
comment: App is very helpful. Gives me good insight into consumption and solar generation and is accurate and on time. So far it hasn't let me down. Good historical data and has allowed me to modify behaviours and consumption to suit my solar PV generation. Very useful.

author: Ben Wisbey
comment: Worst paid app I have ever used

author: Neville Smith
comment: Simply cannot get it to connect following the instructions provided.

author: D D
comment: Useless

author: Paul van der Zel
comment: Watch app does nothing other than say "Loading data..." (Moto 360). Rest of app is OK, I like the widgets.  Fix the watch app please!

author: Anne-Marie Alder
comment: Fed up with it still not being up to date. The graph still shows 14 october 2016. Have spoken to u on phone about this months ago but still not fixed. Not happy.

author: Peter Williams
comment: This app started out being quite useful but over time various functions have just stopped working and it is now effectively useless.

author: ericredding
comment: You may make great solar inverters with decent internet access.   But you let someone design the worst interface I've seen I can barely read the numbers on my phone.... it looks good but its useless.   Power consumption figures etc is all I need to see and lets face that is all the people who paid you $1000's for your inverter system want to see.  Rather than have large numbers telling me this I've got miniature curved numbers on a background of white and washed out grey numbers.   What idiot thought this was  a good idea. So if you must keep this crap interface,  just produce an alternative Big number version for your clients who actually want to use it and for the "Grid feed in" mark the numbers in red RED if we are drawing from it.  For such an innovative company you need to get some decent web / app designers because currently they are rubbish ! The fact you have to to back to solar web old to access most data makes it so obvious!!

author: Jason Roberts
comment: Server goes down a lot.

author: Vatoe
comment: The pro version doesn't seem to accurately display total kWh. When I use the free app and then compare this to the actual  inverter readings they are the same,  but the pro version seems to lag behind which also means the widget displays the wrong value as well.
title: The free version seems to better?

author: Jason Pontre
comment: The app used to work well, now most of the time it's saying my system is offline. (When I know it's not because I check the inverter and it's producing) Called Fronius for help 3 weeks ago, still waiting for call back.
title: Used to work

comment: Displayed data does not match the information as found right on the Fronius inverter webserver. Therefore total $$ and kWh information is very inaccurate. Why does this app not sync with the data already on the inverter? It's like it started taking data only after creating online account. That leaves my information off by months! I want my money back. Seriously.
title: Useless

author: Peter Birkett
comment: This is a really good app for live monitoring of your PV system. It doesn't seem to accurately report how much energy my system is exporting to the grid as it always shows 100% feed in. Pro version is definately worth the value.
title: Nice app

author: Peter Schmid
comment: Installing the system was expensive. Now I have to pay again for this App to view my data and it looks and feels like some student had it's first go.
title: Far below expectations

author: Thusitha Udugama
comment: Used to work.  Not anymore. Error logging in and app closes. Reinstalled but problem persist.
title: Tpu

author: Todd Kealey
comment: (1) allow me to add notes about the day's weather, (2) allow me to see more than just the last 7 days of data, (3) data export to Excel for configurable time periods
title: Needs enhancements

author: Andrew Dent
comment: New version keeps crashing when going into monthly bar charts, particularly when switching between power and kwp, before this it was 5 stars
title: Was good

author: Denny H
comment: It never is but it can't connect to the network. The network setup wizard is the worst. It is slow and the whole connection process will take more than 30 minutes. Even after the process goes through it still will not connect!  The whole setup needs to be reworked through the app and with a firmware update on the inverter.
title: System always offline!

author: Robert Wood
comment: Keeps crashing , work out the bugs please or refund our money back.

author: Neil Bowman
comment: It's pretty good, but I'm still wondering why this is better than the original free version.

author: Chad Mcdonald
comment: Crashes as soon as you login, stay with the free version and wait for the next update!!
title: Crashing

author: dilesh wadia
comment: Don't waste your money on this app the free app actully works way better than this app. 2/3 of this app literally dosent work. If you can find it get the old "solar.web" app.

reply.author: Fronius International GmbH
reply.content: The only problem was that the peak power of your inverter was set wrong on solarweb.com. It should work now.

title: Don't waste your money

author: Travis Wills
comment: Worth getting if you have the fronius smart meter

author: David Bowers
comment: All this does is force close. Hopefully Fronius gets this sorted.
title: All it does is force close

comment: No data on phone or tablet via this app for three days now......?
title: Not Working

author: Scott Miller
comment: Crashes everytime
title: Problem is

author: Dayakar Reddy
comment: Helpful app
title: Gravismeds school of nursing

author: Jeffrey Foote
comment: The free app cost too much.  I don't know much about the technology or superiority of Fronius.  But I do know the function and ease of the app is pathetic.  I got burned and it cost way more than 2.99.
title: Really?

author: Michael Delpach
comment: Amazing

I do wish it didn't display functions for accessories we don't have. Othetwise .... It's made watching the power we use etc something quite interesting. As the data pool grows the more interesting it's becoming to see just what the system does.                                                    By the way ... during full moon the panels produce voltage. Not enough to do anything with .. but interesting.

author: Peter Kerwin
comment: Handy, but room for improvement. The Android app doesn't show values on the main animation - you have to zoom in on each component to read a value (see the screenshots above). The webpage Solar.web animation shows PV, consumption and grid feed kW values all at the same time - much easier to understand at a glance. Further, a screen capture only shows stationary dots - no direction info. Two-colour dots or arrows, along with kW values on each arm of the schematic, would be much more helpful than just the blue dots.  In fact a little more colour throughout, especially on the charts, would make things easier to take in at a glance.  Also, setup menus really need more in-app (and more complete on-line) instructions. Another annoyance for me - Total Income on this app on my Samsung Note 2 is stuck on $1, yet the Webpage and iOS version shows a more likely value - while I can adjust this on other versions, I can't seem to change it on this Android version. Considering this is the paid-for version, it should be much better than it is.
